name: Filter of small particles/pores by sizes (binary)

controls.name: pixelSize
controls.caption: Pixel size
controls.description: The side of every pixel in some units, for example, in microns. All parameters of objects will be measured in this units (microns or square microns).

items.caption: Remove small particles / fill small pores
Return filled small particles / pores (without pores in them)

controls.name: maxSize
controls.caption: Maximal size
controls.description: Find only particles/pores, which size is ≤maximal size. If not specified, it is ignored, i.e. supposed to be +∞ when "Logic of conditions" is AND or −∞ when it is OR. Here "size" means the maximum from 4 values: width=max(x)−min(x)), height=max(y)−min(y)) and two diagonal dimensions (max(x+y)−min(x+y))/√2̅, (max(x−y)−min(x−y))/√2̅.

controls.name: maxArea
controls.caption: Maximal area
controls.description: Find only particles/pores, which area is ≤maximal area. If not specified, it is ignored, i.e. supposed to be +∞ when "Logic of conditions" is AND or −∞ when it is OR. Here "area" means the number of pixels inside the boundary of a particle/pore (including any inner pores/particles).

controls.name: maxPerimeter
controls.caption: Maximal perimeter
controls.description: Find only particles/pores, which perimeter is ≤maximal perimeter. If not specified, it is ignored, i.e. supposed to be +∞ when "Logic of conditions" is AND or −∞ when it is OR. Here "perimeter" is the length of polyline between middles of segments — sides of square pixels, separating objects and background.

controls.name: conditionLogic
controls.caption: Logic of conditions
controls.description:
What does mean "a particle/pore is small" (and should be filtered: found or removed).
    AND: a particle/pore is "small", if ALL three conditions above are fulfilled:
size ≤ maximal size, and area ≤ maximal area, and perimeter ≤ maximal perimeter. If any of the limits is 0.0, no particles/pores will be found (unless you set "Ignore zero maximums" flag below). This is the default behaviour.
    OR: a particle/pore is "small", if ANY of three conditions above is fulfilled:
size ≤ maximal size, or area ≤ maximal area, or perimeter ≤ maximal perimeter. If all the limits are 0.0, no particles/pores will be found. In this case, empty string for any limit means −∞ or 0 (both variants are equivalents, because correct sizes/areas/perimeters are always positive). The flag "Ignore zero maximums" has no effect.

items.caption: OR (any of the conditions is true)

controls.name: ignoreZeros
controls.caption: Ignore zero maximums
controls.description: If set, zero values in the three parameters above will cause the corresponding limit to be ignored, as if it had be not been specified: 0 will be interpreted as +∞ when "Logic of conditions" is AND or as −∞ when it is OR. If cleared (default value), zero limits are interpreted as usual. Note that this flag actually has no effect when "Logic of conditions" will is OR, because all measured parameters are always positive.
